body:
Please file this bug report at https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/new.

---

## What happened

i cut & pasted the source code from https://codewithandrea.com/articles/2019-06-03-simple-authentication-flow-with-flutter/#:~:text=%20Super%20Simple%20Authentication%20Flow%20with%20Flutter%20%26,to%20show%20a%20centered%20RaisedButton%2C%20which...%20More%20

It produced an error listing beginning with:
E/flutter (15140): [ERROR:flutter/lib/ui/ui_dart_state.cc(157)] Unhandled Exception: PlatformException(error, FirebaseApp with name [DEFAULT] doesn't exist. , null)

The mobile test device shows nothing but a whtire screen with a "chasing circle" idle animation in the center.

## Version information

Android Studio `3.5` â€¢ Flutter plugin `io.flutter 40.0.2` â€¢ Dart plugin `191.8423`

Woah! You appear to be trying to run flutter as root.
   We strongly recommend running the flutter tool without superuser privileges.
  /
ðŸ“Ž
Flutter 1.12.13+hotfix.5 â€¢ channel stable â€¢ https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
Framework â€¢ revision 27321ebbad (8 months ago) â€¢ 2019-12-10 18:15:01 -0800
Engine â€¢ revision 2994f7e1e6
Tools â€¢ Dart 2.7.0

## Exception

null

```

	at com.intellij.openapi.application.TransactionGuardImpl$2.run(TransactionGuardImpl.java:315)
	at com.intellij.openapi.application.impl.LaterInvocator$FlushQueue.doRun(LaterInvocator.java:435)
	at com.intellij.openapi.application.impl.LaterInvocator$FlushQueue.runNextEvent(LaterInvocator.java:419)
```

comment_data.body: Thanks for the report! I see you're on version `40.0.2` of the IntelliJ plugin; that's fairly old at this point (~8 months?). Can you try updating your plugin, or, updating to a newer version of android studio (which should select a newer version of the plugin)?

title: Error running authentication example
